thread.title: Mozambique: Sweden Pledges Budget Support for 2016
thread.title_full: Mozambique: Sweden Pledges Budget Support for 2016

title: Mozambique: Sweden Pledges Budget Support for 2016
text:
Angola: Mourners Protest Alleged Police Brutality 
Sweden is a founder member of the PAPs (Programme Aid Partners), the grouping of 16 donors and funding agencies that provide at least some of their aid to Mozambique in the form of direct budget support. In 2014, Sweden was the second largest donor of bilateral aid to Mozambique, and disbursed 109 million dollars in budget support. 
Nyoni said “Sweden believes in the capacity of the Mozambican government to translate into reality its ambitions for greater economic, political and social inclusion, which would benefit the poorest strata of the population through strengthening democracy”. 
Recalling that this year is the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between Sweden and Mozmbique, Nyoni urged the government to prioritise programmes and reforms for inclusive development, laying stress on democracy, gender equity, agriculture, good governance, the protection of human rights, access to information and the fight against corruption. 
Among the many sectors of the Mozambican economy covered by Swedish aid are electricity, oil and gas, fisheries and tourism. Mozambique
